result.execSummary:
The defendant Goebel L. Bellomy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the  ( - left up to discretion of agent.)sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $ 500.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  May Not have contact with Tara F unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Goebel L. Bellomy, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments are made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.  As a condition court imposes and stays 90 days in the KCJ with Huber.   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and if any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. No contact with Tara F.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Goebel L. Bellomy, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on October 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Goebel L. Bellomy, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
Atty Caviale states he received an offer from the State last night and requests an adjournment to allow DE time to consider the offer.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
From United Hospital System

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney John Louis Caviale appeared on behalf of defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Caviale requests an adjournment stating DE is currently ill and had to go to dialysis today, proof provided in court.  FPT adj. to 9/2/15 at 10:10 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Goebel L. Bellomy, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
Parties are close to resolving case and request an adjournment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 09:50 am.

1:16 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney John Caviale.  Clerk:  LE.   Referred to Br. 8 for further disposition on 6-18-15 @ 8:30 am FPT.  Information filed.  Not guity plea entered.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John Caviale. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information not filed. State to file information within statutory time limits. Arraignment on 5-19-15 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.
